[Measurement, Evaluation, and Data Science (MEDS)](https://www.ualberta.ca/educational-psychology/graduate-programs/measurement-evaluation-and-data-sciences/index.html) at the [University of Alberta](https://www.ualberta.ca/index.html) is Canada's largest graduate program focusing on educational measurement, evaluation, and data science, with four full-time faculty members and a large alumni network around the world.


The MEDS program welcomes students to a supportive and collaborative environment, where they become an integral part of innovative research conducted by the MEDS faculty members. Students studying in MEDS find a broad range of theoretical and applied learning opportunities through research and teaching assistantships, internships, and statistical consulting.


For more details, please check out our website: <https://sites.google.com/ualberta.ca/meds>
